Package com.accele.gage.entity

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.accele.gage.entity.Entity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cleanable, Indexable, Renderable, Tickable
    public abstract class Entity
extends java.lang.Object
implements Indexable, Tickable, Renderable, Cleanable
    A general-purpose entity class used for displaying objects to the screen.

    This class contains a few primary base capabilities: graphical display, logical processing, and collision detection. All instances of Entity override Renderable for rendering to the screen, Tickable for updating Entity logic, Cleanable to free any potential resources the entity might have, and Indexable to keep track of entity types.

    Even though Entity contains a registryId, it is not used in any particular Registry. Instead, this value is used to track entity types within the EntityHandler, which contains all entities that the engine is currently processing.

    This class also contains basic collision detection through the use of one of two built-in types of BoundingBox: AABB or OBB. The EntityHandler automatically keeps track of Entity collisions and will call the collide(Entity) method when two entities collide.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    William Garland

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entity

        public Entity​(java.lang.String registryId,
              BoundingBox bounds)
        Creates a new Entity with the specified registryId and bounds.

        To exempt this Entity from collision detection, either pass in null for the bounds parameter or set the global setting setEntityCollision(boolean) to false.

        Parameters:
        registryId - the registryId of the Entity
        bounds - the BoundingBox of the Entity used for collision detection

    • Method Detail

      • collide

        public abstract void collide​(Entity other)
        Called whenever this Entity collides with other according to its BoundingBox.

        Collision detection is done through the use of one of two built-in types of BoundingBox: AABB or OBB.

        To exempt this Entity from collision detection, either pass in null for the bounds parameter or set the global setting setEntityCollision(boolean) to false.

        Parameters:
        other - the Entity that this Entity is colliding with

      • onDeath

        public abstract void onDeath()
        Called whenever this Entity dies.

        Entities are killed via the die() function. die() will call this method directly before calling Cleanable.clean(). The Entity will not be removed from the EntityHandler until the end of the current game loop cycle.

      • getRegistryId

        public java.lang.String getRegistryId()
        Description copied from interface: Indexable
        Returns the registry ID to use in the Registry. This ID must be unique within the registry.
        Specified by:
        getRegistryId in interface Indexable
        Returns:
        the registry ID to use in the Registry

      • getBounds

        public BoundingBox getBounds()
        Returns the BoundingBox used for detecting collisions.
        Returns:
        the BoundingBox used for detecting collisions

      • isDead

        public boolean isDead()
        Returns whether this Entity is dead.

        Entities are considered dead once their die() method has been called. Dead entities are automatically exempt from collision detection.

        Returns:
        whether this Entity is dead

      • die

        public void die()
        Kills this Entity.

        This method will call onDeath() followed by Cleanable.clean() and then place the Entity in the removal queue. Dead entities are automatically exempt from collision detection. This method will do nothing if this Entity is already dead. The Entity will not be removed from the EntityHandler until the end of the current game loop cycle.
